metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19623 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.6.0 to 2.6.4 and 2.4.0 to 2.4.10, the LBMPDM dissector could crash. In addition, a remote attacker could write arbitrary data to any memory locations before the packet-scoped memory. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-lbmpdm.c by disallowing certain negative values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
tshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-1~ubuntu14.04.1').
